title: Hospital York Maine | Vaccines & Travel | York Hospital
description: Learn about vaccines and travel medicine with the doctors and healthcare staff at York Hospital, serving patients throughout Southern Maine.
cleaned_text: Vaccine Services & Travel Medicine Need a Flu Vaccine? Visit One Of Our Community Drive -Thru Flu Shot Clinics at York Walk-In Care, 343 U.S. Route 1, York. Clinics will be held from 1 p.m. to 6 p.m. on the following dates: Thursday, September 22 and Friday, September 23 Thursday, October 20 and Friday, October 21 Thursday, November 17 and Friday, November 18 [Click here for more information](https://www.yorkhospital.com/flu-vaccine-information/) Vaccine Services & Travel Medicine at the York Hospital main campus location Please note that appointments are necessary and we cannot guarantee availability for all vaccines due to national supply changes. It is important to call to ensure that the vaccine you need is available. Located at 12 Hospital Drive, Suite B York, ME 03909 Phone: [(207) 351-3530](tel:(207)351-3530)Fax: [(207) 351-3574](tel:(207)351-3574) [As of Monday, July 18, 2022, our phone systems will be on auto attendant between 12 p.m. and 1 p.m.Please click here for more information.](https://www.yorkhospital.com/flu-vaccine-information/) Hours: Monday - Friday, 8:30 a.m.-5:00 p.m. Please note that you should call the office at least six weeks in advance of any travel plans to book your appointment with one of our Infectious Disease physicians. You will be pleased to meet our friendly and knowledgeable travel doctors and clinicians at Travel Medicine and Vaccine Services of York Hospital. We have been serving our community's travel and vaccine needs for nearly two decades. By appointment, our clinical staff and physicians are ready to dispense the most current advice about travel destinations, travel alerts and vaccinations. Our clinic is a designated Yellow Fever Vaccine Center. The best way to learn about and protect yourself from the disease risks associated with international travel is to call us at 207-351-3530 at least 6 weeks in advance of your departure to book an appointment with one of our Infectious Disease physicians. We are not able to book an appointment until we have received your complete vaccine records. - Our specialists also address the needs of our communities by offering protective vaccines that are requirements of college programs, employment and those ordered by your clinician. - Some health insurance companies will cover the cost of vaccinations and medications like Malaria pills required for travel, but not all insurances do. Please check with your health insurance company prior to your appointment.
